value.ai_summary:
Here's a comprehensive technical summary of the markhazleton.github.io repository:

This is a personal Jekyll-powered static website repository designed as a sophisticated, developer-friendly platform for publishing technical content and personal blog posts. Built using Ruby, Jekyll 4.3+, and leveraging a customized Minima theme, the site implements a responsive, accessibility-conscious design with a modern dark/light mode toggle and comprehensive markdown-based content management system. The project demonstrates advanced static site generation techniques, including automated GitHub Actions deployment, robust post creation workflows with detailed SEO and content guidelines, and a well-structured development environment supporting local and remote publishing. Notably, the repository provides an extensive README that serves not just as documentation, but as a comprehensive guide for Jekyll site development, content creation, and deployment best practices. The site is targeted at technical professionals, developers, and content creators seeking a professional, easily maintainable personal website platform with strong emphasis on developer experience and technical documentation standards.
